post.title: Latin American Initiatives for Mapping Violent Criminal Groups
post.excerpt: The meeting is an initiative of the international research network Evidence in Governance and Politics (EGAP), in partnership with Leme – Violence Reduction Laboratory, the Brazilian School of Public and Business Administration at the Getulio Vargas Foundation (FGV EBAPE), the Inter-American Development Bank (IDB), and Los Andes and EAFIT Universities (Colombia).
post.content:
The meeting is an initiative of the international research network Evidence in Governance and Politics (EGAP), in partnership with Leme – Violence Reduction Laboratory, the Brazilian School of Public and Business Administration at the Getulio Vargas Foundation (FGV EBAPE), the Inter-American Development Bank (IDB), and Los Andes and EAFIT Universities (Colombia).

The event aims to discuss various data-driven projects designed to measure the presence and activity of organized criminal groups in different Latin American contexts. To this end, a high-level discussion forum will be held to examine the usefulness, limitations, and validity of different methodologies developed in academia, civil society, and public security institutions.

This is an invitation-only meeting, with participants including representatives from Public Security and Criminal Justice forces of the State of Rio de Janeiro, the federal government, Colombia, Ecuador, Chile, and Argentina; 12 researchers from foreign universities; and civil society representatives working in public security. The meeting seeks to consolidate best practices and methodologies that can contribute to a systematic measurement of organized criminal group presence in Latin America.
